title: Simplest Barbecue Spice Rub
description: My go to barbecue rub for pulled pork and brisket.
imageAlt: A jar of BBQ rub with different spices.
imageTitle: A jar of BBQ rub with different spices.
ingredients: 1/3 cup of coarse ground black pepper
steps: Combine all ingredients together in your dish of choice. I like to use a mason jar.
Stir until well combined. I'll typically shake the jar to mix it up.
Apply liberally!

title: Apple Blackberry Pie
description: This is my all-time favorite treat. A must-make every holiday season.
imageAlt: An apple blackberry pie with an oat topping

title: Instant Pot Pot Roast
description: Such a delicious and simple and fast way of making pot roast
imageAlt: A delicious looking pot roast and vegetables

sectionIngredients: 1/2 tsp smoked paprika (regular paprika is fine too)
1 Chuck roast. Each pound feeds about 2 people. I usually get a 3 pound roast.
1 pound of full size carrots. Cut in about thirds
2-3 pounds of mini potatoes. If you have larger potatoes, just cut them up
6 stalks of full-size celery, ends cut off, cut in half

steps: Combine all of the seasoning mix ingredients together in a dish and set aside.
Set your Instant Pot on Saute.
Season the roast liberally on all sides with salt and pepper.
Coat the bottom of the instant pot with a high smoke point oil (canola, vegetable, peanut, etc...) and sear the roast on all sides.
Remove the roast and set it aside.
Take a little bit of the beef broth and deglaze the bottom of the pot. Probably about a cup or half a cup.
Add the roast back to the pot, along with your assortment of vegetables.
Take a part of your seasoning mix and sprinkle it over the roast and vegetables.
Add the rest of your beef broth into the pot along with two bay leaves.
Add in the rest of your seasoning mix into the pot.
Close and seal your Instant Pot and set it to manual for 95 minutes.
If you have time, let it naturally release. It will probably take about 45 minutes. If not, you can force the release.
Enjoy! It also makes great leftovers heated up in the microwave.

title: Popcorn Seasoning
description: A smoky, delicious seasoning for popcorn
imageAlt: Some popcorn surrounded by salt, pepper, paprika, and chilis
ingredients: 1 tablespoon of coarse ground black pepper
steps: Combine all ingredients together in your dish of choice. I like to use a mason jar.
Stir until well combined. I'll typically shake the jar to mix it up.
Apply liberally!

title: Chicken Florentine
description: A delicious creamy florentine sauce with crispy chicken.
imageAlt: creamy sauce with chicken and noodles

title: One Pot Cajun Pasta
description: A delicious creamy and spicy cajun pasta
imageAlt: penne noodles with parsley, sausage, and a creamy sauce
ingredients: 4 oz (1/2 cup) fresh grated parmigano reggiano (regular parm is fine too)
steps: Chop up your sausage and brown in your pan
Chop up your garlic and add when your sausage is almost done. Cook for a few minutes until garlic is fragrant
Add your chicken broth, cream, and pasta all to the pot. Stir to combine
Add in half your cajun seasoning and allow to cook until pasta is al dente
Turn off the heat and stir in the cheese until fully incorporated. Add in the rest of your cajun seasoning
Sprinkle your chopped parsley on and serve hot!

title: Birria Tacos
description: Slow cooked shredded beef, cooked in a birria consomme, with pepperjack cheese
imageAlt: Fully stuffed tacos with beef and cheese, next to a bowl of consomme
steps: Take your chuck roast, trim the hard fat off, and cut into large chunks
Season liberally with salt and pepper
Brown the meat in a large pot (big enough to fit everything in)
Turn the heat to low, and add in eight cups of water
Add in your peeled garlic, roughly chopped onion, your dried chilis, your taco seasoning, beef bullion cubes, and your bay leaves
Cover and let simmer for 2-3 hours
Remove your peppers, garlic, and onion from the pot and blend them together with some of the broth from the pot. Return this blended mixture to the pot
Cook for another hour or so until your meat is tender
Remove the meat from the pot and shred it in a bowl with some of the consomme from the pot
Dip your tortillas in the consomme and fry them in a pan
Add your shredded beef and cheese to the tortillas, and fold them over, frying them on both sides

title: Cast Iron Cornbread
description: A moist, sweet, delicious buttermilk cornbread
imageAlt: A cornbread with a slice from it in a cast iron pan with accouterments around it
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups fine cornmeal (medium grind is acceptable, large won't work)
steps: Mix all ingredients in a large mixing bowl except butter and flour
Pour the melted butter into the mixture and mix
Pour the flour into the mixture and mix
Butter down (you can also use cooking spray) a large cast iron skillet and pour the mixture in
Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean

title: Taco Seasoning
description: A delicious, spicy, full bodied taco/mexican seasoning
imageAlt: A bunch of spices, peppers, and chilis surrounding other spices
ingredients: 2 tsp dark chili powder (regular is fine)
steps: Combine all ingredients together in your dish of choice. I like to use a mason jar.
Stir until well combined. I'll typically shake the jar to mix it up.
Apply liberally in taco soup, enchiladas, tacos, etc...

title: Salmon with Avocado Salsa
description: A classic oven baked salmon with a lemon garlic glaze and an avocado salsa
imageAlt: A salmon adorned with spices garlic and oil, with an avocado salsa

sectionIngredients: 3 Pounds of wild caught salmon (or your preference)
1 tablespoon of fresh minced garlic (can also use garlic from a jar)
Juice of 1 lime (lemon would work too)
1 tablespoon of fresh minced garlic (can also use garlic from a jar

steps: Preheat oven to 375
Take some foil and put it on a large enough oven safe pan for your salmon
Rub the fish lightly with olive oil and crack on your salt and pepper until the salmon is well seasoned
Mix all of your glaze ingredients together and pour your glaze on and over your salmon until it is fully covered and incorporated
Put the salmon in the oven and let it cook for 20-25 minutes or until fully cooked with the sides slightly burning
While the salmon cooks, mix your salsa together
Roughly chop your avocados and put them in a small bowl
Take the rest of your salsa ingredients and mix them into your avocados and mix it well, trying not to mash the avocados too much
When the salmon is done, serve with the salsa on top

title: Shrimp Tacos
description: Shrimp tacos with a spicy rub topped with a tangy salsa
imageAlt: Shrimp and mango salsa in a tortilla surrounded by spices, limes, garlic, and oil
steps: Start to prepare the mango salsa. Grab a dish, dice your mangoes and set in the dish
Dice the red onion and add to the dish
Chop the cilantro and add to the dish
Slice the lime, squeeze in, and mix the salsa
Crack in some sea salt and mix again
Optionally chop your habenero and add to the salsa and mix
Set your salsa to the side, and add some oil to a pan on medium heat
Add your shrimp to the pan, and season with your favorite taco seasoning
Sear off your shrimp and cook to done
Remove your shrimp from the pan, set to the side, and add some more oil and some more taco seasoning to the pan
Add your tortillas to the pan and toast them on both sides
Remove your tortillas from the pan, and assemble your tacos
Enjoy!

sectionIngredients: 1 juicy lime (or 2 if there's not very much juice
OPTIONAL - 1 fresh habenero pepper for heat
1 lb extra small peeled, deveined shrimp (or whatever size you want, if its large, chop them up a little bit)

title: Buffalo Wings
description: Smoked, fried, or air fried chicken wings with a tangy, spicy buffalo sauce
imageAlt: fried chicken covered in a red sauce with celery and dipping sauces
steps: Combine your buttermilk and pickle juice and drop your chicken wings in the mixture
Let the wings sit in the mixture for at least 30 minutes, but up to 24 hours
Combine the rest of the dry ingredients in a ziploc or paper bag and shake to mix
Take your wings out of the buttermilk mixture and drop them in the bag with the dry ingredients, shake vigorously until the wings are well coated, and set to the side
Set a small pot on your stove on low to medium heat and combine your hot sauce and butter
Stir the sauce until the butter is melted and the sauce is well combined
Add the rest of the buffalo sauce ingredients and stir until well combined
Let it just barely bubble on low heat. If it separates, that's OK, just stir it back together

Now, return to your chicken wings. There are a bunch of options, you can oil fry them, smoke them, or air fry them. If you're oil frying them, heat your oil to 375 and fry them for 10-12 minutes, continually flipping until they're done. If you're smoking them, smoke them at 250 for about 1 hour, continuously flipping every 20 minutes until done. If you're air frying them, air fry them at 375 for 25ish minutes, flipping until they're golden brown and crispy
Once your wings are done, toss them in your buffalo sauce and serve with your favorite dipping sauces and veggies

sectionIngredients: 3/4 cup of Frank's Red Hot Sauce
About 2/3 cup cornstarch (not exact, just enough to coat the wings)

title: Bacon Treats
description: A tater tot wrapped in bacon with jalapenos and cheese
imageAlt: A bunch of tater tots wrapped in bacon topped with jalapenos and cracked black pepper with cheese poking out
ingredients: A bunch of tater tots (probably about 32 if you're doing the full pound of bacon
steps: Preheat your oven to 400
Cut your bacon in half down the middle

title: Fondant Potatoes
description: Seared potatoes cooked off with aromatics and chicken broth
imageAlt: A bunch of seared potatoes in broth surrounded by aromatics in a cast iron pan
ingredients: 8 russet potatoes or larger yellow potatoes
High smoke point oil (canola, vegetable, peanut)
2 cups of chicken or vegetable broth
1 head of garlic, top chopped off
A few sprigs of fresh rosemary
A few sprigs of Fresh thyme
A few sprigs of Fresh Sage
steps: Start by peeling the potatoes. Then, trim both ends to create a stable, flat base, allowing the potato to stand upright. Finally, slice each potato in half crosswise.
Coat in a high smoke point oil and copious amounts of sea salt and black pepper
Put a little more oil on your cooking surface and sear both flat sides of the potato. Sometimes I'll sear the sides too.
Add into your pan (use a pan that can withstand a high heat, like stainless steel or cast iron)
Pour in your chicken broth, and add your aromatics around the pan
Cook for about 45 minutes, or until your potatoes are fork tender
Serve hot! Mash with a fork and pour some of the fond on top for a delicious bite!

title: Chipotle Chicken
description: A smokey, spicy, marinated chicken thigh cooked in a variety of ways
imageAlt: A single piece of chicken with a chipotle marinade, topped with herbs and surrounded by spices and chilis

title: Marinated Skirt Steak
description: A citrus-y, mexican, marinated skirt steak
imageAlt: A sliced, seared skirt steak on a plate surrounded by different citruses and spices

title: Award-Winning Chili
description: A deep, rich, spicy chili with a variety of meats, veggies, spices, and beans
imageAlt: A pot of deep red and dark chili with vegetables and beans and surrounded by spices

sectionIngredients: 1 tsp mexican oregano (can sub other oregano)
3 fresh chopped jalapenos (sub one large green bell pepper for less spice)
1 large yellow or white onion, diced
4 oz hatch green chilis (heat is your preference)
3 cans of Medium Bush's Best Chili Magic Chili Starter, Campfire Style

steps: In a small dish, mix together all of the seasoning mix ingredients and set aside.
In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain the fat, but keep the meat in the pot.
In the same pot, brown the sausage over medium heat. Don't drain the fat and keep the meat in the pot
Chop up all the vegetables, and add them to the pot. Cook until veggies are a little softened. Maybe 5 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes and hatch green chilis to the pot. Stir to combine.
Add the tomato sauce to the pot. Stir to combine.
Add in the seasoning mix you prepared before. Stir to combine.
Add in the tomato paste to the pot. Stir to combine.
Let simmer on your stove for about an hour.
Add in the three cans of beans and stir to combine.
Let simmer another 45 minutes to an hour.
Enjoy with your favorite toppings, such as cheddar cheese, sour cream, or maybe fritos corn chips!
